intro: Arabis petiolata, commonly known as the slender rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are elongated and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white, four-petaled flowers during the spring and early summer. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and are often borne on slender pedicels. Arabis petiolata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
